definition: to beat up/to break to pieces
"hand" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 64), occurring in 提, 把, 打 etc
to play music/to achieve/to present a memorial to the emperor (old)
to be beaten/to take a drubbing/buffeted/knocked about

sentences.english: If you don't, he will punch you in the mouth.
sentences.chinese: 如果你不这么认为，他会揍你。

sentences.english: I imagined, therefore, that it was she who was to be deputed to beat me.
sentences.chinese: 我也因此认为她是被委托来揍我的。

sentences.english: Boston punishes teams that don't make quick decisions with the ball.
sentences.chinese: 凯子狠狠的揍了一顿那些不能很快处理球的球队。

sentences.english: If you do not put that down I am gonna punch you.
sentences.chinese: 如果你不把那个放下来，我就揍你。

sentences.english: Haven't you heard Tae lambast me on Thirsty Thursdays about that?
sentences.chinese: 你没有听太渴了周四就揍对我吗？

sentences.english: They threatened to beat him unless he did as they asked.
sentences.chinese: 他们威胁他，如果不按他们说的去做就会揍他。

sentences.english: Parents often say that they spank their children to teach them how to behave.
sentences.chinese: 家长经常说他们揍孩子是为了他们好。

sentences.english: Dinnae ye want her help fightin' the baddies?
sentences.chinese: 你不想让她帮你揍那帮坏蛋？

sentences.english: They caught the thief and lathered him.
sentences.chinese: 他们逮住那个小偷揍了他一顿。

sentences.english: Warren dragged him out and almost murdered him.
sentences.chinese: 华伦把他拖了出来，差点没把他给揍死。

sentences.english: Don't try to cash in on me, or I'II beat you up.
sentences.chinese: 不要想在我身上讨便宜，否则我就揍你。

sentences.english: He threatened the boy with a beating.
sentences.chinese: 他以揍一顿来威胁这个小孩。

sentences.english: Assumedly, he was caught and received a good beating, which seems to be more interesting.
sentences.chinese: 假如就这样被人逮到揍上一顿，那就更有趣了。

sentences.english: If she doesn't know what you're talking about, punch her.
Don't try to cash in on me, or I'll beat you up.
sentences.chinese: 不要想在我身上讨便宜，否则我就揍你。

definition: to be looking for one's teeth all over the floor/(fig.) to get beaten up badly/to beat the crap out of (sb)
to be beaten/to take a drubbing/buffeted/knocked about
a bloody nose and a swollen face/badly battered
half dead (of torment, hunger, tiredness etc)/(tired) to death/(terrified) out of one's wits/(beaten) to within an inch of one's life/(knock) the daylights out of sb
a black eye (idiom); serious injury to the face/fig. a setback/a defeat
a slap on the face/CL:記|记[ji4]
to suffer/to endure/to pull through (hard times)/to delay/to stall/to play for time/to dawdle
